ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Game Development
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: Game development is one of the fastest-growing sectors of the economy, and our students are trained with the skills necessary to join this exciting industry. Our program is a Bachelor of Science (BS) in Game Development which provides a strong foundation in programming, mathematics, and computer science coupled with a variety of game-specific courses and experience. With our comprehensive curriculum, you will learn how to design, develop, test, and publish games for various platforms, including PC, console, and mobile. Our program emphasizes hands-on experience, and students work on real-world game projects throughout their studies. You will learn game design, programming, art, sound, and project management while developing a professional portfolio that will showcase your skills to potential employers. Our Game Development program is designed to prepare students for a successful career in the video game industry, with graduates finding employment as game designers, programmers, artists, quality assurance testers, and project managers. Kutztown University is one of the few Pennsylvania State System of Higher Education (PASSHE) universities that offers a bachelor's degree in game development.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in General Studies
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: The General Studies Degree Completion Program is a unique and flexible bachelor of science degree program designed for those who have some previous college credits but have not earned a degree and wish to complete a four-year bachelor's degree. Students can complete this program at Kutztown University. The program is specifically designed to provide students with the ability to pursue a baccalaureate degree in a manner that takes into consideration their previous educational experiences and current and future academic and career goals. Students will complete courses in a variety of disciplines, including 30 credits in one of three designated subject areas: Humanities, Natural Sciences or Social Sciences. This will allow students to individualize their program of study while achieving breadth and depth in their coursework.

Requirements: A completed application, a nonrefundable $35 application fee, and an official high school transcript.
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description:
Geography is the study of the Earth's landscapes, environments, and peoples. It is a multidisciplinary field that examines the spatial distribution of phenomena, human-environment interactions, and the processes that shape our world. Geographers use a variety of tools and techniques, including Geographic Information Systems (GIS), remote sensing, cartography, and field methods, to analyze and interpret spatial data. The Bachelor of Arts (BA) in Geography at Kutztown University provides students with a strong foundation in geographic concepts, theories, and methods.
The BA in Geography provides students with a broad and flexible liberal arts degree emphasizing the human and physical dimensions of geography, geographic techniques, and the interconnections between people and their environments. The curriculum introduces students to a variety of geographic subfields, including cultural geography, economic geography, urban geography, political geography, population geography, environmental geography, and physical geography. Students also gain proficiency in geographic techniques, including GIS, remote sensing, and cartography. With a strong emphasis on critical thinking, problem-solving, and spatial analysis, the BA in Geography prepares students for a diverse range of careers in both the public and private sectors, as well as for graduate studies.
ScholarshipAmount: Amounts range from $1,000 per year to full tuition scholarships.

Requirements: Students in any major at Kutztown University may minor in Geography by completing the course requirements. To declare a minor in Geography, students must complete the Declaration of Major/Minor form and have it approved and signed by the chairperson of the Department of Geography and the Dean of the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences.
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Fees: In-State (tuition and fees): $10,901.10/year; Out-of-State (tuition and fees): $23,235.10/year
Description: A minor in Geography will complement most majors at Kutztown University and increase your marketability as you begin your career. Geography is a field that offers both breadth and depth in the study of our planet, its environments, and human societies. It emphasizes the integrated understanding of the world, drawing on the natural sciences, social sciences, and humanities. Our minor is designed to provide you with a solid foundation in the fundamental concepts and methods of geographic inquiry, including spatial analysis, cartography, and geographic information systems (GIS). You will explore topics such as cultural landscapes, urban development, environmental sustainability, climate change, and global interconnectedness. By understanding the intricate relationships between people and their surroundings, you will develop a critical perspective on global and local issues, preparing you for a wide range of professional paths or further academic pursuits.

Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Fees: PA Resident: $10,666.50/year; Non-Resident: $22,528.50/year (based on 2023-2024 rates, includes tuition and required fees)
Description: The Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Geology at Kutztown University is a comprehensive program designed to provide students with a strong foundation in geological sciences, preparing them for diverse careers in environmental consulting, natural resource management, geological surveying, education, and research. Our curriculum emphasizes hands-on learning, fieldwork, and research opportunities, ensuring graduates are well-equipped with practical skills and theoretical knowledge. Program Highlights: Experienced Faculty: Learn from dedicated faculty members who are experts in various geological fields, including hydrogeology, geomorphology, paleontology, sedimentology, and structural geology. Field-Based Learning: Participate in extensive fieldwork experiences, including trips to local geological sites, national parks, and international locations, providing real-world application of classroom knowledge. State-of-the-Art Facilities: Access modern laboratories equipped with advanced instrumentation for geological analysis, including GIS software, petrography microscopes, and geochemistry tools. Research Opportunities: Engage in faculty-mentored research projects, presenting findings at regional and national conferences, and contributing to scientific literature. Career Preparation: Develop critical thinking, problem-solving, and analytical skills highly valued by employers in both the public and private sectors. Interdisciplinary Approach: Explore connections between geology and other scientific disciplines, such as environmental science, chemistry, and physics. Curriculum: The B.S. in Geology curriculum covers core geological principles and offers elective courses allowing students to tailor their studies to their interests. Key areas of study include physical geology, historical geology, mineralogy, petrology, structural geology, sedimentology, stratigraphy, geophysics, and hydrogeology. Students also complete coursework in related sciences, mathematics, and general education requirements.
CollegeApplicationFee: PA Resident: $10,666.50/year; Non-Resident: $22,528.50/year (based on 2023-2024 rates, includes tuition and required fees)

Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: Geology is the study of Earth and its materials, structure, and processes, and the history of the evolution of life on Earth. A minor in Geology is an ideal complement to a variety of majors including environmental science, biology, marine science, geography, physics, physical science, and anthropology. The program provides the opportunity to explore Earth processes, resources, and environmental issues without the rigor of a full major.
ScholarshipAmount: Scholarships range from $1,000 to $7,000 per year; some cover full tuition.

Requirements: The minor in German Communication & Culture requires 18 semester hours. Six semester hours from the core courses and 12 semester hours from the elective courses.
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: KU's minor in German Communication and Culture is designed for students who want to develop practical, real-world communicative proficiency in German in a variety of personal and professional situations while also deepening their understanding of German-speaking cultures and societies. The minor combines language, culture, and communication-focused courses and offers students the flexibility to select courses to tailor their program of study to their individual interests and career goals. Students completing the minor will have a unique competitive advantage in a variety of fields including business, technology, international relations, tourism, arts, education and more. They will also be well-prepared to pursue further study of German at the graduate level.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Biochemistry: Pharmacy
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Biology - Molecular/Micro/Cell
Requirements: To apply as a first-year student, the following are required: a completed application (either through the KU application or the Common App), a $35 application fee, and an official high school transcript. Optional documents include SAT/ACT scores, a personal essay, and letters of recommendation.
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description:
The Molecular/Micro/Cell track of the Biology program at Kutztown University is a four-year curriculum designed for students who desire to study biological processes at the molecular, microbial, and cellular levels. Graduates with this degree are prepared to pursue careers in health professions (pre-med, pre-vet, pre-dental, pre-PA, etc.), biotechnology, pharmacy, genetic counseling, or scientific research. The skills developed in this track are also applicable to careers in education, scientific communication, policy, and law. Many students also pursue graduate degrees in a wide array of fields, including molecular biology, microbiology, cell biology, genetics, biochemistry, neuroscience, immunology, virology, toxicology, bioinformatics, and many others.

Students in the Molecular/Micro/Cell track will develop a strong scientific foundation through coursework in biology, chemistry, physics, and mathematics. Students then choose advanced coursework from fields such as molecular biology, microbiology, cell biology, genetics, immunology, virology, bioinformatics, and biochemistry. Students are also encouraged to participate in undergraduate research with a faculty mentor to gain hands-on experience and develop a research project from conception to presentation. Other opportunities include independent study, internships, and student teaching.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Biology - Organismal Biology and Ecology
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: The Organismal Biology and Ecology concentration is designed for students interested in a variety of fields, including natural resource management, conservation biology, field biology, wildlife biology, fisheries biology, animal behavior, evolution, ecology, and systematics. Students take courses in zoology, botany, ecology, evolution, and relevant electives within the Department of Biology and other departments at Kutztown University. Hands-on learning experiences, including field trips, are emphasized in many courses.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Biology - Pre-Medical, Pre-Veterinary, Pre-Dental
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: The pre-medical, pre-veterinary, pre-dental specialization is designed to provide students with the necessary foundation in biological and physical sciences, as well as mathematics, to succeed in professional school and beyond. This specialization offers students the flexibility to pursue careers in medicine, dentistry, optometry, chiropractic, veterinary medicine, podiatry, physical therapy, physician assistant, pharmacy, and other health professions, as well as in biomedical research. This specialization can also be used as a pre-requisite for graduate programs in biology and other related fields. Students are encouraged to meet with their faculty advisor regularly for academic advising and career planning.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Biology: Allied Health
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Biology: Allied Health is designed for students interested in a career in allied health professions such as physical therapy, occupational therapy, physician assistant, chiropractic, optometry, and podiatry. This major meets the pre-requisites for admission to most graduate health professional programs. The curriculum provides a strong foundation in biology, chemistry, and physics, along with specialized coursework in human anatomy, physiology, and medical terminology. Students gain hands-on laboratory experience and develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills essential for success in their chosen field. The program emphasizes a holistic approach to health care, preparing students to work effectively in interprofessional teams and to address the diverse needs of patients.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Biology: Medical Laboratory Sciences
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Biology: Medical Laboratory Science track at Kutztown University prepares students to work in a clinical laboratory as a Medical Laboratory Scientist (MLS). This program offers both a 3+1 program option and a four-year curriculum. Medical Laboratory Scientists (MLS) perform diagnostic analyses on blood and other body fluids and are an integral part of the healthcare team, providing more than 70% of the objective information used to diagnose and treat patients. After successfully completing their clinical internship, students will be eligible to take the American Society for Clinical Pathology (ASCP) Board of Certification Exam. The demand for qualified MLS professionals continues to rise due to advances in medical technology and an aging population. Graduates can work in various settings including hospitals, clinics, blood banks, public health facilities, research and development, forensic laboratories, pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries, quality assurance and control, management, sales and marketing, infection control, and education and training.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Data Science
Requirements: Requirements for admission include a completed application, an official high school transcript showing a solid college preparatory curriculum, the application fee, and optional SAT or ACT test scores. An optional essay can also be submitted.
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Data Science provides students with the mathematical, statistical, computer science, and business skills needed to analyze, interpret, and present data for the purpose of solving real-world problems. The curriculum covers areas such as programming for data science, data management, statistical modeling, machine learning, data visualization, and ethical considerations in data analysis. The program is designed to prepare students for careers in various data-intensive industries, including technology, finance, healthcare, and marketing, or for graduate studies in data science or related fields.

Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: The Disability Studies minor offers an interdisciplinary approach to the study of disability. Students will explore disability from social, cultural, political, historical, and economic perspectives. The minor encourages critical thinking about disability and prepares students to advocate for individuals with disabilities in various professional and community settings. It complements a wide range of majors by providing students with a deeper understanding of disability issues and inclusive practices. Students will develop skills in communication, advocacy, and critical analysis, preparing them for careers in social work, education, healthcare, public policy, and more.

Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: The Minor in Case Management is housed within the Department of Social Work in the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences. The minor is an 18-credit program, designed to educate students about the roles and functions of a case manager in the human services field. Coursework includes an introduction to case management, interviewing skills, basic counseling skills, crisis intervention skills, ethics in human services, and knowledge of the diverse client populations encountered in human services.

Requirements: Kutztown University requires the following items for a complete first-year application: 1. A completed application. 2. Official high school transcripts. 3. $35 application fee. The following items are optional: 1. SAT/ACT scores. 2. Letter(s) of recommendation. 3. Personal essay.
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: Kutztown University's Department of Physical Sciences offers a Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Chemistry. The B.S. in Chemistry provides a broad and rigorous foundation in all areas of modern chemistry. The curriculum is designed to prepare students for careers in chemistry and related fields, or for graduate study. This program is approved by the American Chemical Society. Students in the B.S. program will develop critical thinking, problem-solving, laboratory, and communication skills through a combination of challenging coursework and hands-on laboratory experiences. A wide range of courses and research opportunities allow students to tailor their education to their specific interests.
Accredidation: Approved by the American Chemical Society.

Requirements: A minor in chemistry requires a minimum of 24 semester hours of chemistry. A minimum GPA of 2.0 in the chemistry courses is required for this minor.
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: A minor in chemistry requires a minimum of 21 credits. Students must successfully complete courses in general chemistry, organic chemistry, physical chemistry, analytical chemistry and inorganic chemistry. Students will also be required to complete at least one laboratory course in organic chemistry and one additional laboratory course in physical or analytical chemistry. Students will gain experience with a wide range of chemical principles and techniques that are applicable to a variety of careers. The minor allows students to apply the principles of chemistry to their major, providing an interdisciplinary education that is attractive to employers.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Cinema, Television and Media Production
Department: College of Visual and Performing Arts
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Cinema, Television and Media Production at Kutztown University is a hands-on production-oriented program with students selecting one of two tracks: Cinema or Television. The program combines critical studies courses with core classes in all areas of production and culminates in upper-level courses focusing on writing, directing, editing, cinematography, and sound production within the studentâ€™s chosen track. Graduates of the program are well-prepared for careers in the motion picture, television, and corporate media industries.

ProgramName: Minor in Cinema, Television and Media Production
Requirements: A minimum grade of C must be earned in each course of the minor. Eighteen credits are required for the minor.
Department: College of Visual & Performing Arts
Description: The minor in Cinema, Television and Media Production prepares students for careers in the field of production, focusing on the development of practical and theoretical skills in digital video production, narrative production, documentary production, writing for screen, and the history and theory of cinema. Through a blend of hands-on experience and critical analysis, students will learn to create compelling visual narratives and gain a comprehensive understanding of the media landscape.

ProgramName: Minor in Coaching and Fitness Administration
Department: College of Business
Description: This minor provides students with the fundamental knowledge, skills, and values to successfully pursue careers or further education in the fields of coaching and fitness administration. The program provides the necessary background and preparation to coach at various levels (youth, high school, collegiate) and/or to administer fitness-related programs for schools, businesses, or recreation organizations. The coursework focuses on topics such as sport psychology, exercise physiology, motor learning, strength and conditioning, ethics in sport, and program administration. Graduates will be prepared to take national certification exams in fitness (e.g., ACSM, NSCA) and/or coaching (e.g., NFHS, ASEP).

ProgramName: Bachelor of Fine Arts in Communication Design
Requirements: A portfolio review is required for admission into the B.F.A. in Communication Design program. General application requirements include a completed application and an official high school transcript. A personal statement is optional but encouraged for students with a cumulative GPA below 3.0.
Department: College of Visual and Performing Arts
Description: The B.F.A. in Communication Design at Kutztown University is a professional program that prepares students for careers in the dynamic field of visual communication. Students develop a strong foundation in design principles, typography, imaging, and digital media, coupled with a deep understanding of communication theory and problem-solving methodologies. The curriculum emphasizes both creative exploration and technical proficiency, fostering the development of a unique artistic voice alongside industry-standard skills. Our graduates are highly sought after by design firms, advertising agencies, in-house corporate design departments, and non-profit organizations. They excel in diverse roles such as graphic designers, web designers, UI/UX designers, illustrators, motion graphics designers, and art directors. The program also provides a strong foundation for those interested in pursuing graduate studies in design or related fields.
ScholarshipAmount: Varies; up to full tuition waiver available for specific scholarships.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Communication Studies
Requirements: To apply for admission to Kutztown University as a first-year student, you must submit the following items: a completed application for admission (either the KU application or the Common Application), your official high school transcript, and a $35 application fee or fee waiver. Submission of SAT or ACT scores, an essay/personal statement, and letters of recommendation are optional.
Department: College of Visual and Performing Arts
Description: Communication Studies is a highly adaptable and marketable liberal arts degree. The Communication Studies program at Kutztown University provides students with an understanding of human communication processes and their role in society. In addition to general coursework in communication studies, students will select coursework from two of four distinct areas within the discipline: Interpersonal Communication, Media Communication, Organizational Communication, and Public Communication. This approach allows students to tailor their studies to their specific interests and career goals. Students develop strong critical thinking, analytical, research, and communication skills, which are highly valued in various professional fields and for graduate studies. The Department of Communication Studies fosters excellence in teaching and learning through a curriculum that emphasizes critical thinking, research, and effective communication skills. Our faculty are experts in their fields, providing students with engaging instruction and mentorship. We offer a variety of experiential learning opportunities, including internships, student media organizations, and research projects, to prepare students for successful careers or advanced academic pursuits. Graduates with a Bachelor of Arts in Communication Studies are well-prepared for a wide range of careers in fields such as: Public Relations, Marketing, Advertising, Human Resources, Media Production, Journalism, Corporate Communications, Non-profit Management, Education, and Law. The analytical and communication skills developed in the program are also excellent preparation for graduate studies.

Requirements: The Communication Studies minor is an 18-credit program. Required courses include COM 110, COM 220, and either COM 230 or COM 240. Students must also complete nine credits of electives chosen from a specified list of COM courses. A minor must include 18 credits, with 9 credits at the 200 level or higher. No more than 6 credits may be used to satisfy requirements for both a major and a minor.
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: The minor in Communication Studies provides students with insight into the theories and practices of human communication. The minor covers a wide range of communication topics, including interpersonal, small group, public, organizational, intercultural, and media communication. Students completing the minor will develop the knowledge and skills necessary to effectively communicate in a variety of personal and professional contexts.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
Requirements: Your application to Kutztown University will be reviewed once we receive your official high school transcript. In addition to your transcript, you are welcome to submit the following optional materials to be reviewed: Official SAT or ACT scores; Essay/personal statement; Letters of recommendation.
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Computer Science program at Kutztown University is committed to providing students with an education based on current computer science theory and practice. The curriculum emphasizes object-oriented programming, data structures, algorithm analysis, operating systems, and computer organization. Students will apply their knowledge to build a strong foundation for a variety of careers in fields such as software development, database administration, network security, and game development. The program focuses on analytical and problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and written and oral communication. In addition to a core curriculum, students select from three concentrations that meet their career goals and interests. These concentrations are in applied computing, cybersecurity, and game development.
Accredidation: The Bachelor of Science programs in Computer Science and Information Technology are accredited by the Computing Accreditation Commission of ABET, http://www.abet.org.

Requirements: Minors and certificates can be declared by using the online "Change of Major" form, which is found in the student's MyKU account.
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: A Computer Science minor gives students a basic knowledge of computer programming and general purpose computing. Students will develop foundational programming skills, learn about basic data structures and algorithms, and gain familiarity with discrete mathematics topics used in computer science. The minor gives students a basic understanding of modern computer hardware and software design issues.
ScholarshipType: Academic, Departmental, and others offered through the KU Foundation.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science-Information Technology
Requirements: A completed online application, a $35 non-refundable application fee, and an official high school transcript are required for an application to be considered complete. Although not required, applicants are strongly recommended to submit a personal statement or essay. Official SAT/ACT Scores are optional as Kutztown University is test-optional.
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Computer Science-Information Technology (BS in CS-IT) degree program combines the theoretical foundations of Computer Science with the practical knowledge and skills required for careers in Information Technology. Graduates will be prepared to enter professions such as software development, network administration, database management, cybersecurity, web development, data analysis, and IT project management. The Computer Science - Information Technology program is designed to provide students with: A strong foundation in computer science principles and theories; Practical skills and knowledge in information technology areas like networking, databases, cybersecurity, and web development; Problem-solving and critical thinking abilities relevant to the IT industry; Opportunities for hands-on experience through projects, internships, and research; Ethical awareness and communication skills essential for professional success.

Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: This minor is specifically designed for students majoring in areas other than computer science and information technology who wish to gain foundational knowledge and skills in these fields. It provides a flexible yet structured curriculum that introduces core concepts of computer science, programming, data management, and network essentials. Students will develop problem-solving abilities using computational thinking, understand the principles of information technology infrastructure, and learn practical applications of software development. This minor complements a wide range of majors, enhancing career prospects in an increasingly technology-driven world by equipping students with valuable technical literacy and analytical skills.
ScholarshipType: First-Year Student Scholarships, Transfer Student Scholarships, Continuing & Current Student Scholarships, KU Foundation Scholarships

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Criminal Justice
Requirements: All first-year students are required to submit the following: Completed online application; $35 non-refundable application fee; Official high school transcript(s). A personal essay is strongly encouraged. Submission of SAT or ACT scores is optional for admission for most majors.
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description:
The Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Criminal Justice program is designed to provide students with a broad and systematic knowledge of crime and justice. Our curriculum offers a comprehensive understanding of the legal, theoretical, and practical aspects of the criminal justice system. Students will explore various topics including criminology, law enforcement, courts, corrections, and victimology, preparing them for a diverse range of careers in criminal justice fields or for advanced graduate studies. The program emphasizes critical thinking, ethical decision-making, and social responsibility, equipping students with the skills necessary to analyze complex issues within the justice system and contribute to its improvement.

Program Objectives:
* To provide students with a solid foundation in criminal justice theories and concepts.
* To develop students' understanding of the structure and functions of law enforcement, courts, and correctional systems.
* To enhance students' analytical, research, and communication skills applicable to criminal justice issues.
* To foster an appreciation for ethical practices, diversity, and social justice within the criminal justice context.
* To prepare students for entry-level positions in various criminal justice professions or for advanced academic pursuits.
ScholarshipAmount: Up to $7,000 per year, or full tuition for specific merit scholarships

Requirements: Any undergraduate student may declare a minor in criminal justice. The student should go to the office of their major and complete a "Change of Major" form indicating that they wish to add a minor in criminal justice.
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: A minor in criminal justice requires 18 credits in criminal justice coursework. Students must complete CRJ 100: Introduction to Criminal Justice and CRJ 225: Criminology. The remaining 12 credits must be in 200, 300, or 400-level criminal justice courses. The minor complements a variety of majors in liberal arts, social sciences, business, and education. It provides students with a general understanding of the criminal justice system and the theoretical explanations of crime. It also prepares students for a variety of careers in the field.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Business Administration in Accounting
Department: College of Business
Description: Accounting is the language of business! It is the system of measuring business activities, processing that information into reports, and making the findings available to decision-makers. The Bachelor of Science in Business Administration in Accounting program at Kutztown University will prepare students to be successful in the accounting profession. Accounting graduates are consistently in demand in public accounting, private industry, and government entities. The profession also offers a variety of specialty areas, such as auditing, taxation, consulting, information systems, and forensic accounting. As technology changes the world around us, the importance of accounting information will continue to grow.
Accredidation: Kutztown University's Department of Business Administration is accredited by AACSB International â€“ The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.
ScholarshipAmount: Varies by award; up to full tuition is available.

Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: A minor in Actuarial Science is designed to prepare students for the first two actuarial exams (Exams P and FM) and to provide them with the educational background to pursue a career as an actuary in a wide range of industries including insurance, consulting, banking, and government. Students completing this minor will gain expertise in probability, mathematical statistics, financial mathematics, and basic economics. In addition, students will complete the Validation by Educational Experience (VEE) requirements for Economics and Corporate Finance, recognized by the Society of Actuaries, the Casualty Actuarial Society, and the Canadian Institute of Actuaries. The minor requires 24 credits.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Fine Arts in Animated Arts
Requirements: Acceptance into the B.F.A. in Animated Arts program requires a portfolio review. Students must first apply to the university through the Office of Undergraduate Admissions. General first-year application requirements include a completed online application, a $35 non-refundable application fee or fee waiver, and an official high school transcript. While not required, students are welcome to submit a personal essay and up to three letters of recommendation. Kutztown University is test-optional, so SAT/ACT scores are not required for admission.
Department: College of Visual and Performing Arts
Description: Kutztown University offers a Bachelor of Fine Arts (BFA) in Animated Arts. It is a professional degree in animation that provides a comprehensive study in traditional and computer animation. The program develops strong drawing and design skills and challenges students to think conceptually and creatively. Students explore current and emerging animation techniques and apply them to personal projects in preparation for a career in animation. Upon completion of the program, students will have created a professional portfolio and demo reel that showcases their strengths and talents within a specific area of animation.

Requirements: A completed application and $35 application fee. Official high school transcript(s) must be sent directly from the high school. SAT/ACT scores, an essay or personal statement, and letters of recommendation are all optional for admission.
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: Anthropology is the study of humankind in all its diversity, throughout time and across the world. Our Anthropology BA program is designed to develop the students' critical and analytical skills, as well as their ability to understand and communicate about human diversity. It is a holistic field that encompasses all four major subfields of anthropology: archaeology, cultural anthropology, biological anthropology, and linguistic anthropology. In your coursework, you will learn about the major theoretical approaches and methodologies that frame the study of humanity, as well as gain research skills and a broad awareness of the global human experience. The Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) program in anthropology will provide you with a broad-based knowledge of anthropology that includes exposure to all four subfields: archaeology, cultural anthropology, biological anthropology and linguistics.

Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: An anthropology minor provides students with a foundational understanding of what it means to be human, both biologically and culturally. The minor can complement a wide variety of majors, helping students to develop cross-cultural perspectives, critical thinking skills, and an appreciation for human diversity. Anthropology minors can pursue careers in archaeology, cultural resource management, museum work, international development, forensic science, and public health.

Requirements: Students interested in declaring a minor in applied engineering should contact the department office.
Department: College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Description: The minor in applied engineering will introduce students to the foundational concepts and practices in electrical and mechanical engineering. These skills will improve the breadth of education of our students and improve their competitiveness for employment in a wide range of industries. It also provides a useful foundation for students considering graduate study in engineering.

Requirements: Applicants must submit a completed application, a $35 application fee, official high school transcript(s), and an essay or personal statement. Kutztown University is test-optional regarding SAT or ACT scores. Letters of recommendation are optional. Admission to the BFA in Studio Art program also requires a portfolio review, which must be submitted digitally via SlideRoom after the student has officially applied for admission to the university.
Department: College of Visual and Performing Arts
Description: The Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) in Art program at Kutztown University is a liberal arts degree that provides students with a broad and flexible education in the visual arts. The B.A. program offers students the opportunity to combine their interest in visual art with a second major or minor in another academic discipline. Students in the B.A. program complete foundation coursework in 2D design, 3D design, drawing, and art history. They then take courses in multiple studio art areas such as painting, sculpture, printmaking, photography, digital art, ceramics, and metals. The program also requires additional courses in art history and general electives. The B.A. in Art prepares students for a variety of career paths including arts administration, museum work, art therapy, gallery management, and graduate studies in art or related fields.
Accredidation: The Art Department at Kutztown University is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).

Department: College of Visual and Performing Arts
Description: The minor in Art is an excellent choice for students who want to develop their artistic skills and knowledge while pursuing another major. It provides a flexible curriculum that allows students to explore various artistic disciplines, including drawing, painting, sculpture, ceramics, photography, and graphic design. Students will gain a foundational understanding of art history, theory, and practice, while also having the opportunity to specialize in areas of interest through elective courses. The minor in Art complements a wide range of majors, enhancing creativity, problem-solving abilities, and visual literacy.
Accredidation: The Department of Art and Design is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).

Department: College of Visual and Performing Arts
Description: The B.S. in Education with a major in Art Education is a program of study for individuals who wish to become certified to teach art in public schools in grades Pre K-12. Kutztown University has one of the largest and most well-respected art education programs in Pennsylvania. Graduates of the program are certified to teach art in public schools in Pennsylvania and other states through reciprocity agreements. Our program is designed to develop art teachers who are outstanding studio artists, reflective teachers and scholars, and articulate advocates for art and art education.
Accredidation: Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP) â€” Nationally accredited; Pennsylvania Department of Education (PDE) â€” State approved.
ScholarshipAmount: $1,000 - $6,000 per year, up to full tuition

Department: College of Visual and Performing Arts
Description: The Art Education minor is designed to provide students majoring in Art with a general overview of the field of art education and its professional practices. Courses address issues in curriculum design, methods of teaching, assessment, and other topics relevant to teaching art in K-12 settings. This minor can complement a variety of undergraduate majors and prepare students for further graduate study in art education and/or for careers in art instruction outside of public school settings.

Requirements: In a holistic review, Kutztown University considers the following: Academic performance in high school, Strength of curriculum, Grade trends, SAT or ACT scores (optional for most majors), Letters of recommendation (optional), Essay or personal statement (optional), Extracurricular activities/community service/work experience.
Department: College of Visual and Performing Arts
College of Visual and Performing Arts
Description: A minor in Art History offers students in any major the opportunity to supplement their primary course of study with knowledge of the visual arts from ancient times to the present. In addition to a broad range of courses, the minor requires students to select 12 credits of upper-level courses. The minor in Art History can be an enriching supplement to a variety of majors, including Anthropology, Communications, English, History, Modern Languages, Music, Philosophy, Psychology, and Theatre. Art History students are prepared for careers in galleries, museums, preservation, conservation, education, and graduate study.
ScholarshipAmount: Up to full tuition or $7,000 per year depending on the scholarship.
